name: Bigleaf Periwinkle
climate: Bigleaf Periwinkle thrives in temperate climates, particularly in areas with mild temperatures.
This plant can also adapt to subtropical climates, making it versatile in various regions.
In Mediterranean climates, Bigleaf Periwinkle grows well due to similar temperature ranges.
It struggles in extreme cold climates; hence, is better suited for moderate zones.
sunlight: Bigleaf Periwinkle prefers partial shade, making it ideal for woodland or shaded garden areas.
It can tolerate full shade, providing flexibility in planting locations around homes and gardens.
Avoid planting in full sun, as excessive direct sunlight can stress the plant significantly.
Dappled sunlight conditions mimic its natural habitat, promoting healthier growth and blooms.
watering: Water Bigleaf Periwinkle regularly, especially during dry periods to keep the soil moist.
Although drought-tolerant, regular watering once a week helps maintain lush foliage.
Ensure the plant is not overwatered; good drainage is essential to prevent root rot.
During the winter, reduce watering to adjust for lower evaporation rates and dormancy.
soil: Bigleaf Periwinkle grows best in well-drained soil enriched with organic matter like compost.
The plant tolerates poor soils but prefers slightly acidic to neutral pH for optimal growth.
Loamy soil types provide the right balance of nutrients, moisture, and drainage for healthy development.
Compacted or heavy clay soils should be avoided; these can lead to poor drainage and root issues.
toxic: Bigleaf Periwinkle is toxic to pets and humans if ingested; it can cause nausea and vomiting.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning helps maintain its shape and encourages denser growth for better ground cover.
